text: Jean-Baptiste Cinéas (1895 - 1958) was a Haitian novelist and jurist. Born in Cap-Haïtien, Cinéas held a law degree and was appointed a judge of the Supreme Court of Haiti, a position he held until his death. His most well-known novels are Le Drame de la Terre (1933), La Vengeance de la Terre (1940), L'Héritage Sacré (1945), and Le Choc en Retour (1949). ==References== * Category:1895 births Category:1958 deaths Category:Haitian judges Category:Haitian male novelists Category:People from Cap-Haïtien Category:20th-century Haitian novelists Category:20th-century male writers
title: Jean-Baptiste Cinéas
